data.title: Cybersecurity Workshop by Kaspersky
data.text:
Evgeny has worked in Software development since 1999, with 20 years’ experience in the IT Security industry. Evgeny joined Kaspersky Lab in 2007 as software development team lead. Since then, he has worked on notable projects such as leading the Kaspersky Lab team at Sochi 2014 Olympic Games to protect their critical IT infrastructure from malware and targeted attacks. Since 2014, Evgeny has driven Kaspersky Lab’s ICS cyber security research, product and services development. He is currently the Head of Kaspersky Industrial Control Systems Computer Emergency Response Team (Kaspersky ICS CERT).

Senior solution architect for Kaspersky Machine Learning for Anomaly Detection. He is in the front line working with customers from manufacturing, energy, oil and gas, and other industries, helping them to assess and deploy AI-powered solutions. Maxim's personal contribution to Kaspersky product development focuses on real-time telemetry stream processing and application of diagnostic rules. Previously Maxim has been leading product development and system integration for a broad spectrum of customers in industry, transport, and finance. Maxim holds Master of Science degree in Physics from Novosibirsk State University.

Head of development of predictive analytic product “Kaspersky Machine Learning for Anomaly Detection” (MLAD) that provides early faults and attacks detection in technological processes in different industrial environments. Andrey is a head of Kaspersky Neuromorphic Platform based on spiking neural networks (SNN) supporting first Russian neuromorphic chip AltAI.

Marketing director with a keen understanding of performance marketing and over 10 years’ experience in IT. In September 2022, she joined the KasperskyOS team to raise the profile of Cyber Immunity. Her immediate plans focus primarily on improving the position of Cyber Immune solutions in target markets, maximizing brand awareness and communicating the value of Cyber Immunity, not only to CSOs but also to CIOs and business users
